title: DeltaV3.org branded DuckDuckGo search site with theme settings and no on-site search history

requirements.text: Create the DeltaV3.org branded UI shell with a black-and-purple default theme, including global layout (header/main/footer), page title/metadata, and a clean “domain-style” aesthetic consistent across all screens.

quotes: i want the Name to be DeltaV3
i want the them black and purple
i want it too look cool like a domain
i want the webiste name to be DeltaV3.org

acceptanceCriteria: Default styling uses a black background with purple accents (buttons, focus rings, highlights).
All primary screens share consistent spacing/typography/color tokens (no mixed themes).

requirements.text: Use the uploaded image (148783974.png) as the site logo in the header and any other appropriate branding locations without altering the image content.

quotes: for the logo i want this image.

acceptanceCriteria: The logo displayed in the UI matches the uploaded image (148783974.png).
Logo renders crisply at common sizes (e.g., ~32–64px in the header) without distortion.
Logo is included as a frontend static asset (not served from backend).

requirements.text: Implement a search page that queries DuckDuckGo and displays results in-app using a legal/public endpoint (e.g., DuckDuckGo Instant Answer API), including a search input, submit action, loading state, error state, and a results list with clickable links.

quotes: i want duckduckgo as the search engine

acceptanceCriteria: User can enter a query and submit via button and Enter key.
UI shows a loading indicator while the request is in-flight and an error message on failure.
Search results render in a list with titles/snippets when available and clickable outbound links.

If the chosen DuckDuckGo endpoint cannot be fetched due to browser restrictions (e.g., CORS), the app provides a clear fallback action to open the query on https://duckduckgo.com/?q=<query> in a new tab.

requirements.text: Add a Settings tab/page where users can customize the theme colors (at minimum the primary accent color used for UI highlights) and apply changes immediately across the app.

quotes: i also want  settings tab where people can change the color of the theme

acceptanceCriteria: There is a visible “Settings” navigation entry/tab.
Settings allow changing at least the primary accent color used throughout the UI.
Theme updates apply immediately across all pages/components.
Theme preference persists locally on the device (e.g., localStorage) and does not require login.

requirements.text: Ensure the app does not store users’ search queries/history on the site (no backend persistence and no local “search history” feature).

quotes: make it so the searches don't show up in your search history
No saving of search history on the site itself

acceptanceCriteria: No backend endpoints or stable storage are used to store queries or search history.
The UI does not display a “recent searches” or history list.
No code writes search queries to localStorage/indexedDB/cookies for history purposes (theme settings persistence is allowed).

constraints: Do not implement proxying, unblocking, cloaking, or any functionality intended to bypass network/content restrictions.
Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (backend/main.mo); add migration.mo only if stable state is introduced (not required for this build).
nonGoals: Building a proxy website or any mechanism to evade filters/restrictions.
“Cloaking” the website or hiding user activity from device/browser/network-level history or monitoring.
Implementing third-party authentication beyond Internet Identity.
